Authors: Richard, Heryadi Y., Lukas, Trisetyarso A.
Title: Leverage from Blockchain in Commodity Exchange: Asset-Backed Token with Ethereum Blockchain Network and Smart Contract
Affiliations: Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11840, Indonesia; Computer Science Department, BINUS Graduate Program, Doctor of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara Univesity, Jakarta, 11840, Indonesia; Cognitive Engineering Research Group (CERG), Faculty of Engineering, Universitas Katolik Indonesia Atma Jaya, Jakarta, 12930, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Richard, Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11840, Indonesia, Computer Science Department, BINUS Graduate Program, Doctor of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara Univesity, Jakarta, 11840, Indonesia; Heryadi, Y., Cognitive Engineering Research Group (CERG), Faculty of Engineering, Universitas Katolik Indonesia Atma Jaya, Jakarta, 12930, Indonesia; Lukas, Computer Science Department, BINUS Graduate Program, Doctor of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara Univesity, Jakarta, 11840, Indonesia; Trisetyarso, A., Computer Science Department, BINUS Graduate Program, Doctor of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara Univesity, Jakarta, 11840, Indonesia
Abstract: Ethereum is one of the most popular blockchain platforms with a high number of adoption in the blockchain world today. Ethereum token (ERC-20) can tokenize any real-world object while it is also possible to exchange the token across the network participants. This utility from the token drives many blockchain enthusiasts to create decentralized applications. ERC-20 token could be used to collect project funds, decision voting, or even can be used to provide investment platforms for people that want to hedge the volatility of the currency with buying an asset that is back to back with the crypto-token. This research shows the main characteristics of asset-backed token and its implementation on a complete end-to-end “digitalization assets system” (assets buy and assets redemption). The result shows that asset-backed token needs support from government and other legalizing parties to verify the legitimacy of the asset that backing the token itself. © 2021, The Editor(s) (if applicable) and The Author(s), under exclusive license to Springer Nature Singapore Pte Ltd.
Author Keywords: Asset-backed token; Blockchain; ERC-20; Ethereum; Token
Index Keywords: Ethereum; Financial markets; Fintech; Commodity exchange; End to end; Real-world objects; Blockchain

Title: Converging artificial intelligence and blockchain technology using oracle contract in ethereum blockchain platform
Source title: 2020 5th International Conference on Informatics and Computing, ICIC 2020
Affiliations: School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Information Systems Department, Jakarta, 11840, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Richard, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Information Systems Department, Jakarta, 11840, Indonesia; Surya, M.M., School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Information Systems Department, Jakarta, 11840, Indonesia; Wibowo, A.C., School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Information Systems Department, Jakarta, 11840, Indonesia
Abstract: Artificial Intelligence (AI) and blockchain are two emerging concepts that explored exponentially in recent years. In software development, artificial Intelligence offers a sophisticated enhancement on the programming logic, while blockchain technology provides transparency and relief the obligation to trust in a central party. Both are two different technologies but considered a disruptive technology in recent years. Artificial Intelligence faces several issues related to the validity of data, algorithms, and policies, while blockchain is called so 'friendly' with transparency, trust, and immutability. Both technologies are still in the early stages of their development age. Always, the opportunity for both technologies to converge in some ways would be an exciting area to be explored. This research elaborates on the technical possibilities of application development on the blockchain platform that communicate with AI to do prediction task. Oracle contract allows the data inside Ethereum blockchain to interact with the external data source. © 2020 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Artificial Intelligence; Blockchain; Ethereum; Machine Learning
Index Keywords: Blockchain; Computation theory; Ethereum; Software design; Transparency; Application development; Disruptive technology; External data sources; Prediction tasks; Programming logic; Artificial intelligence

Authors: Richard, Trisetyarso A., Suparta W., Kang C.-H., Abbas B.S.
Title: Crypto-governance in Stock Exchanges: Towards Efficient and Self-regulated Trading System
Source title: Proceedings of the 4th International Conference on Contemporary Computing and Informatics, IC3I 2019
Affiliations: Bina Nusantara University, Information System Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Richard, Bina Nusantara University, Information System Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Trisetyarso, A., Bina Nusantara University, Information System Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Suparta, W., Bina Nusantara University, Information System Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Kang, C.-H., Bina Nusantara University, Information System Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Abbas, B.S., Bina Nusantara University, Information System Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: Crypto-governance is gaining traction in stocks, commodities, and other derivatives trading in the exchange market, especially when products in the market move towards hyper liquidity. The governance enables an opportunity to share distributed and cryptographic-protected trade platform among trade parties. The crypto-governance perspective is trying to converge various innovations in blockchain applications. When designing crypto-governance, the scheme needs to provide cohesive decision making derived from diverse parties. This research targets to determine how crypto-governance perspective could benefit the stock exchange in regulating and providing a self-regulated trading system efficiently. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Blockchain; Crypto-governance; Stock Exchange; Trading System
Index Keywords: Decision making; Financial markets; Exchange markets; Stock exchange; Trading systems; Commerce

Title: Integration process between terminal operating system and enterprise resource planning system in state-owned port business
Source title: 2019 IEEE 9th International Conference on System Engineering and Technology, ICSET 2019 - Proceeding
Affiliations: Bina Nusantara University, Information System Department, Jakarta, 11840, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Richard, Bina Nusantara University, Information System Department, Jakarta, 11840, Indonesia; Angelia, Bina Nusantara University, Information System Department, Jakarta, 11840, Indonesia; Holyson, C., Bina Nusantara University, Information System Department, Jakarta, 11840, Indonesia
Abstract: The purpose of this paper is to analyze and review the integration process between front-end logistics system in the form of a Terminal Operating System (TOS) and Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) system which is undergone in a state-owned port business (XYZ). The requirements gathering is already done to identify and analyze the requirements of this project. The design process uses agile development methodology, whereas the testing process uses unit test and system integration test. The testing processes provide insight and understanding of system integration implementation process. The result of unit test and system integration test shows that the main business processes are fulfilled and accommodated successfully as the result of system integration. This system integration brought several benefits and value in the form of increased effectiveness in data exchange between systems in the business process cycle, accuracy on the exchanged data due to the occurring data validation done on the middleware level, and the efficiency of data exchange due to use of the developed web services that is integrated and supports real-time data update. © 2019 IEEE.

Authors: Richard, Gaol F.L., Warnars H.L.H.S., Abdurachman E., Soewito B.
Title: Development of Web Application based on ITIL - Incident Management Framework in Computer Laboratory
Source title: Proceedings of 2019 International Conference on Information Management and Technology, ICIMTech 2019
Affiliations: Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Computer Science Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Computer Science Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Richard, Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Computer Science Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Gaol, F.L., Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Computer Science Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Warnars, H.L.H.S., Computer Science Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Abdurachman, E., Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Computer Science Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Soewito, B., Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Computer Science Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: While Information Technology becomes the interesting topic in education, Computer Laboratory as a learning center becomes an important supporting facilities in Higher Education. Whereas, current awareness level of service quality for higher education management is quite lower than the enterprise management. In the daily operation of IT Service Management (ITSM) in Computer laboratory, service activities in computer laboratory mostly uncontrolled and not standardized. By maximizing the service standard level in computer laboratory, university could maintain customer satisfaction subsequently. This research will focus in creating an IT Service Model, Service Standard Process, and the web application by referring to ITIL-Incident Management Framework as a best practice of ITSM framework. The design process use UML diagram as the tools in drawing the process flow of system. © 2019 IEEE.

Index Keywords: Customer satisfaction; Information management; Computer laboratory; Enterprise management; Higher education; Incident Management; IT service management; IT service management (ITSM); Service activities; Service standards; Laboratories

Title: Asset management system for computer laboratory
Source title: Journal of Theoretical and Applied Information Technology
Affiliations: Bina Nusantara University, School of Information Systems, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Oktavia, T., Bina Nusantara University, School of Information Systems, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Richard, Bina Nusantara University, School of Information Systems, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Wongso, A., Bina Nusantara University, School of Information Systems, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: Asset has a very important role and significant value to support operational business. Although a number of organization prefer to use outsourcing and leasing services to manage the asset, but some organization prefer to buy their own and manage their assets. Currently maintaining asset is not an easy task, organization need to be considered about how to use the asset effectively. Information System can help the organization to manage assets, maintenance and repair of assets, calculate asset depreciation, and asset reallocation among divisions in organization. Information System as a media becomes very important to help the management of assets to be more coordinated. Laboratory ABC as part of the computer laboratory at university in Jakarta, is currently had many problems about asset management because there are a lot of devices to be maintained. The assets in computer laboratory are consists of hardware, software, and many other supporting devices. Based on these problems, the research is perform to analysis the process in asset management as well as to formulate and implement a framework of information system that suitable with the management of existing assets in laboratory ABC, so all data can be managed with the system. The method for this research is based on object-oriented analysis and design. The result of this research is an asset management system to support operational laboratory ABC process. © 2005 - 2015 JATIT & LLS. All rights reserved.
